intro: Hyacinthoides non-scripta, commonly known as the bluebell, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to western Europe. It is characterized by its fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 centimeters and produces slender, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually a deep blue or violet, though white or pink variations exist. The bluebell plays an important role in woodland ecosystems and is a symbol of spring in many regions.
